intro: Bryanthus empetriformis var. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. This variant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with a rosette of leaves that help reduce water loss. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
